archetype_name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
name: Spicy Dak-Galbi Rice Bowls with Avocado-Jalapeño Salsa and Quick Pickled Red Onions
description: Korean-style gochujang chicken stir-fry over Spanish rice with a fresh Latin avocado-jalapeño salsa and quick pickled red onions. Built hot and from scratch for a bold family feast.
prep_steps: Cut chicken thighs into bite-size strips.
In a bowl, whisk gochujang, soy sauce, rice vinegar (2 tbsp), sesame oil, sugar, garlic (minced), black pepper, and chilli flakes. Toss in chicken to coat; marinate 15–20 minutes.
Thinly slice red onion and place in a small bowl with rice vinegar (2 tbsp) and a pinch of salt and sugar. Toss and set aside to quick pickle.
Dice tomatoes and avocado; mince jalapenos; chop coriander. In a bowl, combine with lime juice and a pinch of salt to make salsa.
Slice onions and bell peppers; shred cabbage.
Measure spanish rice, water, and salt.
cook_steps: Heat a medium pot over medium heat. Add 1 tbsp canola oil and spanish rice; toast 1 minute, stirring.
Add water and 1 tsp salt. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 15–18 minutes until tender. Rest off heat, covered, 5 minutes.
Heat a large skillet or grill pan (or OutdoorGrill with a flat plate) over high heat. Add 1 tbsp canola oil.
Stir-fry sliced onions and bell peppers 2–3 minutes until charred-tender; add cabbage and cook 1–2 minutes more. Season with a pinch of salt. Transfer to a bowl.
Add remaining 1 tbsp canola oil to the hot pan. Add marinated chicken in an even layer. Sear 3–4 minutes, then toss and cook 3–4 minutes more until cooked through and lightly charred.
Return vegetables to the pan with the chicken and toss 30–60 seconds to glaze and heat through. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Fluff the spanish rice with a fork.
Assemble bowls: rice, spoon over the spicy chicken and vegetables, top with avocado-jalapeño salsa, and finish with quick pickled red onions.
